intro: Lepyrodia, commonly known as the "spearwort," is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Polygonaceae. Lepyrodia species typically produce small, greenish or yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. They are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, including parts of Europe, Asia, and North America. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
